subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 26, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESKey Test Vote On Immigration Looms
Despite conservative opposition, President Bush appears optimistic about winning Senate approval for immigration legislation
                        before the week is over. The bill must first pass a key procedural vote today. More...Watch: Bush On Immigration Reform
• Paris Hilton Gets Out Of Jail
                     					| Watch• WWE Wrestler And Family Found Dead• Good Weather Helps Fight Tahoe Wildfire
                     					| WatchU.S.Jessie's Mom Looks Suspect In The Eye
Patricia Porter, mother of Jessie Davis, tells CBS News she wants her daughter's accused murderer to have a fair trial,
                        but also wanted him to know she was there in the courtroom. Her grandson, she says, tries to call his mother every day. More...Watch: Jessie Davis' Mom Interviewed
• WWE Wrestler And Family Found Dead• Good Weather Helps Fight Tahoe Wildfire
                     					| Watch• Floyd Landis: Champ Or Cheater?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldMideast Quartet May Appoint Blair An Envoy
The U.S., EU, U.N and Russia met in Jerusalem and, among other issues, discussed a new role for outgoing British Prime Minister
                        Tony Blair. Blair indicated he would do it. Russia's reluctance has delayed the announcement. More...
• Mexico Suspends Top Cops For "Trust Tests"• U.K. Flooding Kills 3, Traps Hundreds• Afghan Opium Production Soars By 49%• More StoriesPoliticsThe Supreme Court Veers Right
Three 5-4 rulings by the Supreme Court have the White House and the GOP smiling. Rupert Murdoch's China ties under scrutiny.
                        And why is the U.S. an Internet slow poke? Joel Roberts has the best of the day's headlines. More...Watch: 2008 Election Ads
• GOP Senator: Iraq Strategy Not Working• Blair Meets Arnold On Last Day In Office• Immigration Deal Irks Some Kennedy Allies• More StoriesHealthCDC: Number Of Uninsured Adults Rises
The number of adults without health insurance jumped by 2 million from 2005 to 2006, a new federal report says. Uninsured
                        Americans numbered 43.6 million last year, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. More...
• Omega-3s May Help Prevent Blindness• Top Spots For Household Bacteria• Cord Blood: To Save Or Not?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechProdigious Penguins Populated Peru
Giant penguins as tall as 5 feet roamed what is now Peru more than 40 million years ago, much earlier than scientists thought
                        the flightless birds had spread to warmer climes. More...
• Feds Order At Least 4 Tire Brands Recalled• Tests To Solve Shark Pregnancy Mystery • Freecycling: Something For Nothing Online• More StoriesBusinessFeds Order At Least 4 Tire Brands Recalled
U.S. safety officials have ordered a New Jersey tire importer to recall as many as 450,000 tires that it bought from a Chinese
                        manufacturer and sold to U.S. distributors under at least four brand names. More...
• Home Sales Slow To 4-Year Low• Fired CBS News Producer Sues Network• Americans Donated $295B In 2006• More StoriesEntertainmentParis Hilton Gets Out Of Jail
A smiling Paris Hilton walked out of a Los Angeles County jail early Tuesday, officially ending a bizarre, three-week stay
                        that ignited furious debate over celebrity treatment in the jail system.
                         More...Watch: Paris: A Free Woman
• Floyd Landis: Champ Or Cheater?
                     					| Watch• Fired CBS News Producer Sues Network• Lohan Will Be Doing Extended Care In Rehab
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionChecking The Government
Despite their historical stigma, government bureaucrats as an entity have checked the overbearing power wielded by the Bush
                        administration in matters of national security and education, claims the Nation. More...
• A Liberal "Unfairness Principle"• Bring On The Third Party Candidates!• Tracking Down Andy's Lexus
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Master Baker Shares Secrets
Elisa Strauss of New York's Confetti Cakes demonstrates on The Early Show how to create cakes to wow all comers. More...

                                    riot, killing one man and injuring 14 others.
